pullRequest.title: Created helper for inline array allocation
pullRequest.bodyText:
Created inlineAllocateIndexableObject helper function to handle
allocation of indexable flattened or unflattened classes by calling one
of:

inlineAllocateIndexableValueTypeObject for flattened array classes
inlineAllocateIndexableObject for unflattened array classes with no
unflattened flattenables

Replaced explicit usages of the inlineAllocateIndexableValueTypeObject
method with the new inlineAllocateIndexableObject helper.
Related to: #9200
Signed-off-by:Oussama Saoudi oussama.saoudi@ibm.com

nodes.bodyText: Add a comment saying "unflattened class that contain the J9ClassContainsUnflattenedFlattenables flag will return NULL"

this comment should be moved to the inlineAllocateIndexableObject header.
Also, minor nitpick: Perhaps re-word as Unflattened array classes that contain
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -753,6 +753,8 @@ class VM_VMHelpers
 	 *
 	 * If allocation fails, a heap OutOfMemory error is set pending on the thread.
 	 *
+	 * Unflattened class that contain the J9ClassContainsUnflattenedFlattenables flag will return NULL

commit.message:
Created helper for inline array allocation

Created inlineAllocateIndexableObject helper function to handle
allocation of indexable flattened or unflattened classes by calling one
of:
- inlineAllocateIndexableValueTypeObject for flattened array classes
- inlineAllocateIndexableObject for unflattened array classes with no
unflattened flattenables

Replaced explicit usages of the inlineAllocateIndexableValueTypeObject
method with the new inlineAllocateIndexableObject helper.

Related to: https://github.com/eclipse/openj9/issues/9200

Signed-off-by: Oussama Saoudi <oussama.saoudi@ibm.com>
